title: Add configurable file patterns
description: The supported file extensions are hardcoded. Add a configuration option to customize included/excluded patterns.

title: Add LRU cache for query embeddings
description:
Repeated identical search queries recalculate embeddings each time, wasting API calls and adding latency.

Add a small LRU cache for query embeddings:
```typescript
// Cache recent query embeddings to avoid re-computing
const queryCache = new LRUCache<string, number[]>({ max: 100 });
```

This would significantly improve performance for repeated queries during a session.

title: Refactor dashboard singleton for better testability
description:
src/dashboard/index.ts uses module-level state (serverInstance) which makes testing difficult.

Current pattern:
```typescript
let serverInstance: DashboardServer | null = null;
```

Consider refactoring to a factory pattern or dependency injection for better testability and to enable multiple instances in different test scenarios.

title: Add test suite
description: The project has no test suite. Add unit tests for the chunking logic, embedding backends, and search functionality to improve reliability.

title: Complete or remove dashboard beads integration
description:
src/dashboard/beads.ts has only 3% test coverage and appears to be work-in-progress or incomplete functionality.

Options:
1. Complete the beads integration with full test coverage
2. Remove the module to reduce maintenance burden
3. Document it as experimental/unstable

Current state creates technical debt - either finish the feature or remove it to keep the codebase clean.

title: Persist index metadata
description: Store metadata about what was indexed (timestamp, file count, backend used) to help with status reporting and debugging.

title: Add more embedding backends
description: Support additional providers like OpenAI embeddings, Cohere, or local models via transformers.js for more flexibility.

title: Preserve error context and stack traces
description:
In src/index.ts:317-326, error context is lost when returning error responses:

```typescript
text: \`Error: \${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}\`,
```

Improvements:
- Log full stack traces server-side for debugging
- Optionally preserve stack traces in debug mode
- Consider structured error types for different failure modes

title: Parallelize file processing during indexing
description:
In indexFull/indexIncremental, files are processed sequentially. For large codebases, this is slow.

Consider using a worker pool or Promise.all with concurrency limiting for I/O-bound operations:
- Reading files from disk
- AST parsing
- Chunk generation

Use something like p-limit to control concurrency (e.g., 10 files at a time).

title: Improve test coverage for dashboard/index.ts, beads.ts, and type-guards.ts
description:
Several modules have 0% or very low test coverage:
- src/dashboard/index.ts - 0% (singleton management logic)
- src/dashboard/beads.ts - 3%
- src/utils/type-guards.ts - 0%
- src/config.ts - 50% (lines 117-155, 176-196 uncovered)

Add comprehensive tests for these modules to improve overall coverage from 71% to 85%+.

title: Add search result filtering by path and language
Add smart batching for large embedding operations
description:
The embedBatch method in embedding backends processes all texts in a single request. For very large batches (1000+ chunks), this can cause:
- Timeouts
- Memory issues
- API rate limit errors

Implement chunked batch processing that breaks large batches into smaller sub-batches (e.g., 100 items each) with configurable batch size.

title: Add incremental indexing
description: Currently indexCodebase() re-indexes everything. Add file modification tracking to allow updating only changed files, significantly speeding up re-indexing.

title: Add client-side rate limiting for Jina API
description:
While retry logic exists for API failures, there's no client-side rate limiting. The Jina API has rate limits that could be hit during large indexing operations, causing cascading failures.

Implement:
- Token bucket or leaky bucket rate limiter
- Configurable requests-per-second limit
- Backpressure handling during batch operations

title: Add progress reporting during indexing
description: For large codebases, add streaming progress updates during indexing rather than waiting for completion.

title: Add graceful shutdown handling
close_reason: Implemented graceful shutdown handling with SIGTERM and SIGINT signal handlers

title: Add index corruption detection and recovery
description:
If the LanceDB index becomes corrupted (e.g., process killed during write), there's no automatic recovery mechanism.

Implement:
- Checksum validation on index load
- Automatic corruption detection
- Auto-rebuild option when corruption is detected
- Better error messages guiding users to run clear_index + index_codebase

title: Add checkpoint-based indexing for large codebases
description:
Large indexing operations that fail partway through restart from scratch, wasting significant time and API calls.

Implement checkpoint-based indexing:
- Save progress after each file or batch of files
- On restart, detect incomplete indexing and resume from last checkpoint
- Clean up partial state on successful completion

This is especially important for:
- Large codebases (1000+ files)
- Unreliable network connections (Jina API)
- Long-running index operations

title: Audit and clean up type-guards.ts
description:
The src/utils/type-guards.ts module defines type guards but has 0% coverage, suggesting they may be partially unused. 

Options:
1. Add tests and use them more consistently across the codebase
2. Remove if redundant (Zod validation already handles much of this)

Audit usage and decide on appropriate action.

title: Improve configuration validation error feedback
description:
loadConfig() silently falls back to defaults on invalid config, making it hard to diagnose configuration issues.

Improvements:
- Warn users about specific validation failures
- Show which fields failed validation and why
- Suggest corrections for common mistakes
- Add a 'validate_config' tool for explicit config checking

Example output:
```
[lance-context] Warning: Invalid config in .lance-context.json
  - chunking.maxLines: Expected number, got string '100'
  - search.semanticWeight: Value 1.5 exceeds maximum 1.0
  Using default values for invalid fields.
```

title: Improve search result ranking
description: Add re-ranking or hybrid search (combining semantic + keyword) for better precision on specific queries.

title: Implement AST-aware code chunking
description: The current chunking is line-based (100 lines with 20-line overlap). Implement AST-aware chunking that respects function/class boundaries for more meaningful search results.

title: Track embedding model version in index metadata
description:
When the embedding model changes, old embeddings become semantically incompatible even if dimensions match. Currently only dimension mismatches trigger reindexing.

Example: Switching from 'nomic-embed-text' to 'mxbai-embed-large' (both 768 dims) produces incompatible embeddings but no reindex is triggered.

Store model identifier in metadata and force reindex when model changes:
```typescript
interface IndexMetadata {
  // existing fields...
  embeddingModel: string;      // e.g., 'nomic-embed-text'
  embeddingBackend: string;    // e.g., 'ollama'
  embeddingModelHash?: string; // optional: hash of model weights
}
```

title: Expand AST chunker language support beyond TypeScript/JavaScript
description:
ASTChunker currently only supports TypeScript/JavaScript. Many codebases use multiple languages.

Consider adding support for:
- Python (high priority - very common)
- Go
- Rust
- Java

Options:
1. Use tree-sitter for multi-language AST parsing
2. Create language-specific chunkers with a common interface
3. Document the limitation prominently if not implementing

At minimum, ensure graceful fallback to line-based chunking for unsupported languages.
